org.gerstner.oauth2android.response
Class ErrorParser

java.lang.Object
  org.gerstner.oauth2android.response.ErrorParser

public class ErrorParser
extends java.lang.Object

Static class containing methods that are capable of recognizing specific errors by their names and return the appropriate Exception. This is especially usefull to recognize OAuth 2.0 errors that are returned without the use of a http error code.

Author:
Christoph Gerstner
See Also:

Method Detail

getException

public static OAuthException getException(java.lang.String error)
If a requst is invalid or contains errors that are OAuth 2.0 specific, the server may return an error code as for example 401 Unautorized. In most cases however the server will return a 302 or similar http status code and add a error indication as a parameter to the request. The server may also provide a detaild error description or an url leading to a website comtaining more information. The server MUST however return error - parameter wich can have the following meanings:
  • invalid_request - the request is missing a parameter or is otherwise invalid. See: InvalidRequestException
  • invalid_client - the client could not be identified. See InvalidClientException
  • invalid_grant - the authorization grant is not valid. See InvalidGrantException
  • unauthorized_client - the token is not valid or is of the wrong type. See: UnauthorizedClientException
  • unsupported_grant_type - the client used an unsupported method for the authorization grant. See: UnsupportedGrantTypeException
  • invalid_scope - the scope is incomplete or invalid. See: InvalidScopeException
The method determins wich OAuthException has to be used and returns an instance of this exception for the calling method to throw it.

Parameters:
error - string indicating the error
Returns:
the appropriate OAuthException for the error
